channel.title: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks
channel.description:
This works: `torbrowser https://www.google.com/`
This just launches a new, blank page: `torbrowser https://www.google.com/?`
(Tested on qubes appvm based on an up-to-date whonix-ws-15.)
Inside /usr/bin/torbrowser, something is removing arguments containing questionmarks from `eval`.

item.title: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I don’t know but good that eval could be dropped. Not needed anyhow.

Read full topic
item.source: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks

item.title: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks
item.dc:creator: tatertot
item.description:
Does anyone know why eval drops args containing questionmarks? Maybe some security feature on eval?

The issue doesn’t happen with eval from an interactive bash. And I can’t find any documentation about this wierd eval behavior.

Read full topic
item.source: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks

item.title: torbrowser CLI won't open URLs containing question marks
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/Whonix/tb-starter

fix opening URLs which contain question marks ("`?`")

committed 12:50PM - 01 Nov 20 UTC
adrelanos
+5 -5 
remove `eval` from `tb_run_function` since not needed
http://forums.whonix.org/t/torbrowser-cli-wont-open-urls-containing-question-marks/10514/1
pass `--verbose` to `start-tor-browser`
https://forums.whonix.org/t/system-wide-sandboxing-framework-sandbox-app-launcher/9008/226

Read full topic
